Activity: Log in, check emails. Skim industry news related to health informatics and data quality for 30 minutes.
Review project documentation and data quality reports from the previous week to refresh memory on identified issues. Begin drafting a preliminary framework for root cause analysis.
Outline a structured approach for root cause analysis. This includes defining the problem statement, gathering data, identifying possible causes, testing hypotheses, and recommending solutions.
Send an email to @da-1, @da-2, @qatest-1, @qatest-2, and @clinlead-1 to schedule a brief meeting to discuss the root cause analysis framework and solicit input.
Browse the internet for articles related to data quality root cause analysis methodologies, focusing on examples within healthcare.
Meeting with @da-1, @da-2, @qatest-1, @qatest-2, and @clinlead-1 to discuss the root cause analysis framework. Gather their insights and refine the framework based on their suggestions.
Refine the root cause analysis framework document based on the meeting feedback. Add specific questions to guide the investigation of each data quality issue.

Start working on root cause analysis for the first identified data quality issue (e.g., incomplete patient address data). Gather relevant data, including system logs, training materials, and workflow documentation.
Continue analyzing the first data quality issue. Document the initial findings, potential causes, and hypotheses.
Prepare for tomorrow's work, review notes and set priorities.
